 Methods

Constructor

__construct(string $multiplier) : void

Sets filter options Valid multiplier options: B, KB, MB, GB. Where case is not sensitive.

Parameters

$multiplier

string

Sets default multiplier it's not set in value.

Exceptions

\OSS_Exception If multiplier is not one of $SIZE_MULTIPLIERS KEY.

Takes string input and returns size in bytes.

filter(string $value) : int | bool

10KB, 10Kb, 10kb, 10k input will return 10240 value. 1000 KB, 1000K, 0.98MB input will return 1024000 0.9MB, 0.9m, 0.9mb, 0.9 MB input will return 943718. 2B, 2b, 2 B input will return 2. 0.978GSM, 0.8S7M input will return false; 20 will look for parameter defaults.quota.multiplier in application.ini and use as subfix. else it will return 20.

Parameters

$value

string

String to parse size in bytes

Returns

intbool

Get the multipler (the value by which integers are multiplied when, for example, a text field makes it clear to the user than units are MB rather than B).

getMultiplier() : string

Returns

stringA key from self::$SIZE_MULTIPLIERS

Set the multipler (the value by which integers are multiplied when, for example, a text field makes it clear to the user than units are MB rather than B).

setMultiplier(string $multiplier) : \OSS_Filter_FileSize

Parameters

$multiplier

string

A key from self::$SIZE_MULTIPLIERS

Exceptions

\OSS_Exception

Returns

\OSS_Filter_FileSizefor fluent interfaces

Takes size input and returns formatted string.

unfilter(int $value) : string
Static

10240 input will return 100.00KB value. 1024000 input will return 0.98MB value. 943718 input will 0.90MB return . 20 input will return 20B.

Parameters

$value

int

String to parse size in bytes

Returns

string
